projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
res-long-port-hdpi splash screen is 800px high and should be 854px

When a new app is created we provide android image folders.

I think the "long" should refer to the 854px device and we have a 480x800px splash screen that gets distorted on a WVGA854 device (AVD) - see attached screen which shows a slight distortion (Appc logo triangle is equilateral and looks isosceles in the screen shot).

The reason we should fix this is because clients will most likely use our image as a reference.
fields.summary: res-long-port-hdpi splash screen is 800px high and should be 854px

comments.body:
An 800px tall image is considered valid. Both 800px and 854px fall in the same "hdpi" category.

PhoneGap also recommends 480x800 (https://github.com/phonegap/phonegap/wiki/App-Splash-Screen-Sizes), so I don't think changing the image to 854px is a good idea.

The splash screen should probably be a 9 patch anyways.
Closing ticket as the issue will not fix.
